result.execSummary:
The defendant Bruce F Quante was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant's bond shall be applied towards the fine and costs.  The balance shall be paid by March 25, 2016.  Defendant shall write a letter of apology to the victim which has been done and been preapproved.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bruce F Quante

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Bruce F Quante in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Victim rights complied.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to disorderly conduct - Count 2.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court dismisses and read in count 1 and finds defendant guilty of count 2.  Statement by Attorney Laufenberg.   Court orders $100.00 fine plus court costs; DNA surcharge; letter of apology to the victim which has been pre-approved by the district attorney.  The bond shall be applied with the balance owing by March 25, 2016.  - rt
and Certificate of Appearance for J.J.Z.

Defendant Bruce F Quante in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Laufenberg indicated that he has no objection to the State's standard motions.  Court grants State's standard Motions in Limine.  Jury trial scheduled for January 13, 2016.  - rt

Defendant Bruce F Quante in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of preliminary hearing filed.  Court questions defendant.  Defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waives preliminary hearing. Waive reading of information.  Defendant enters a plea of not guilty to all charges.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 09:45 am.  - rt

Defendant Bruce F Quante in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Defendant waives the time limits for a preliminary hearing.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 01:15 pm.  - rt

Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bruce Quante appeared in custody by video conference.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty requested a $500.00 cash bond and $1,000.00 signature bond with booking; no contact with J.Z. and no possession or consumption of alcohol.  No objection by Bruce Quante.  Court orders $500.00 cash bond and $1,000.00 signature bond; booking; no contact with J.J.Z. - dob:  6-21-79 and no possession or consumption of alcohol.  Notice of right to an attorney given to defendant.  Next court date is an initial appearance scheduled for January 13, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.  mg
